poem:
Title: Waking Notes on a Wistful Dawn

Dublin's CMAT: a symphonic mirth,
In country music's glossy show,
Ritzy distractions cloaking the dearth
Of lost lovers, prices bestowed.
Oh, the irony of a tearful gaze,
Unseen beneath the beehive high,
And the sad symphony plays,
A reality we knowingly deny.
Yet, in self-subjugation's tune,
Mordant echoes of resilience lie.
prompt: You are the poet Robert Hayden. You woke up this morning feeling ironic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The 50 best albums of 2023 – 50 to 9 50CMAT – Crazymad, for Me Coming off halfway between Jenny Lewis and Self Esteem, Dublin’s CMAT sets life’s greatest embarrassments to ritzy country showstoppers – the musical equivalent of piling your beehive high to distract from your tear-reddened eyes. On her second album, she tots up the price she has paid for her bad boyfriends, self-subjugation and knowing avoidance of less-than-romantic realities, always with mordant". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The 50 best albums of 2023 – 50 to 9 50CMAT – Crazymad, for Me Coming off halfway between Jenny Lewis and Self Esteem, Dublin’s CMAT sets life’s greatest embarrassments to ritzy country showstoppers – the musical equivalent of piling your beehive high to distract from your tear-reddened eyes. On her second album, she tots up the price she has paid for her bad boyfriends, self-subjugation and knowing avoidance of less-than-romantic realities, always with mordant
